Explanation: The suggested differential diagnoses do not include any conditions related to 'Cerebral contusion or concussion', which are primarily traumatic brain injuries.
The suggested differential diagnoses do not include any conditions similar to 'Subdural hematoma', which is a type of intracranial hemorrhage.
The doctor suggested 'Orthostatic hypotension', which is directly related to syncope due to a drop in blood pressure upon standing.

The suggested differential diagnoses do not include any conditions similar to Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA), which typically involves neurological symptoms due to temporary blood flow disruption to the brain.
The suggested differential diagnoses do not include any condition that is similar to 'Hypertensive crisis', which typically involves significantly elevated blood pressure.
The suggested differential diagnoses do not include any conditions related to vestibular disorders.
